issue.title: [CF 1181] Check for a spell cast on anyone in raid with a condition
issue.body:
Hi, I'd like to ask some advice on how to set up an anti-grieving icon that would report when someone in raid cast Leap of Faith on another player in raid and the target of that spell was not in combat.

So far I'm setting up a Combat Event icon with both Source and Destination set to "group 1-40". I tested it without the "target is in combat" condition and it's working the way I want it to. The problem is, I don't know how to add that condition. If select Unit Attributes > Unit in Combat, the Unit box only accepts a single unit, not multiple units like "group 1-40". Do I need to use a custom LUA condition for that?
Thank you.

Here's my icon so far:

comments.body:
I got it backwards and closed this ticket while shouldn't have. If you manage to still notice it, I'd still appreciate a response please.

Edited Nov 26, 2015

> Posted by CurseForge user nordveien

There isn't a way to check that because units in combat event icons don't necessarily have unitIDs attached (so you can't check things like whether or not they are in combat).

I think the best that you could do in this case is check if you are in combat, since its probably the case in a raid environment that everyone is in combat at the same time.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Thank you very much for your reply! I agree, that should be enough in most, if not all cases. You can close this ticket now :) Thanks again.


> Posted by CurseForge user nordveien
